definition[0]: to rub something hard, especially with a stiff brush, in order to clean it
example[0]: She was on her hands and knees scrubbing the floor.
example[1]: He scrubbed the dirt off his boots.
example[2]: The table needs to be scrubbed clean.
example[3]: She scrubbed at her face with a tissue.
definition[1]: to decide not to do something that you had planned
example[4]: We scrubbed the idea in the end.
definition[2]: to remove carbon dioxide from the gas that results from burning coal, before letting it out into the air
example[5]: The liquid is used to scrub carbon dioxide from power plant exhaust gases.
definition[3]: low bushes and trees that grow in very dry soil
definition[4]: if you give something a scrub, you clean it by rubbing it hard
example[6]: I gave the floor a good scrub.
